intro: Balsamodendrum socotranum, commonly known as the Socotra balsam tree, is a unique plant native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the family Olacaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, waxy leaves and yellow-orange flowers. The plant is adapted to the arid climate of its native habitat, with features such as reduced leaves and deep root systems to conserve water. Its resin, known as balsam, has been historically used for medicinal and aromatic purposes.
